message.text: fix this code  it to open those apps if not open and  focus them if they're out of focus

parts.text: fix this code  it to open those apps if not open and  focus them if they're out of focus

response.value:
Here's a revised version of your script. This will **launch the app if not running**, and **focus its window if running but not active**. If the window is already active, it does nothing.

````ahk

; ======================================================
; Universal App Launcher / Focus Switcher
; Press your defined hotkeys to launch or activate apps
; ======================================================

; ---------------------
; Example Hotkeys
; ---------------------
#r::RunOrFocusApp("Comet Browser", "CometBrowser.exe", "C:\Program Files\Comet\CometBrowser.exe")
#e::RunOrFocusApp("Everything", "Everything.exe", "C:\Program Files\Everything\Everything.exe")
#c::RunOrFocusApp("Calculator", "Calculator.exe", "calc.exe")
#n::RunOrFocusApp("Notepad", "Notepad.exe", "notepad.exe")

; ---------------------
; Function Definition
; ---------------------
RunOrFocusApp(winTitle, exeName, exePath)
{
    win := WinExist("ahk_exe " exeName)
    if win {
        if !WinActive("ahk_id " win) {
            WinActivate("ahk_id " win)
        }
        ; If already active, do nothing
        return
    }
    ; If not running, launch it
    try {
        Run exePath
    } catch as err {
        MsgBox "Failed to launch " exeName "`nError: " err.Message
    }
}
````

**Key changes:**
- Checks for an existing window with `WinExist`.
- If found and not active, activates it.
- If not found, launches the app.
- No minimize/toggle logic—just focus or launch.

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview). Or explore the [Copilot walkthrough](command:github.copilot.open.walkthrough).

response.value:
Here’s a fixed version of your code. It will **launch the app if not running**, **focus its window if running but not active**, and **activate the first window if multiple are open**. It does not cycle through windows, but always focuses the first found window.

````ahk

#Requires AutoHotkey v2.0
#SingleInstance Force
#+r::Reload  ; Edit script
#+e::Edit   ; Edit script
#q::WinClose("A")  ; Closes the active window
CapsLock::Esc ; CapsLock to Escape
; Esc::Return ; Disable Escape
; Esc::CapsLock ; Escape to capslock

; ======================================================
; Universal App Launcher / Focus Switcher
; Press your defined hotkeys to launch or activate apps
; ======================================================

#r::RunOrFocusApp("CometBrowser.exe", "C:\Program Files\Comet\CometBrowser.exe")
#e::RunOrFocusApp("Everything.exe", "C:\Program Files\Everything\Everything.exe")
#c::RunOrFocusApp("Calculator.exe", "calc.exe")
#n::RunOrFocusApp("Notepad.exe", "notepad.exe")

RunOrFocusApp(exeName, exePath) {
    if !ProcessExist(exeName) {
        try {
            Run exePath
        } catch as err {
            MsgBox "Failed to launch " exeName "`nError: " err.Message
        }
        return
    }
    winList := []
    WinGetList("ahk_exe " exeName, &winList)
    if winList.Length = 0 {
        Run exePath
        return
    }
    ; If not active, activate the first window
    if !WinActive("ahk_id " winList[1]) {
        WinActivate("ahk_id " winList[1])
    }
}
````

**How it works:**
- If the process isn’t running, it launches the app.
- If running, it finds all windows for the process.
- If any window is found and not active, it activates the first window.
- If already active, does nothing.

Let me know if you want cycling through multiple windows!

To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

message.text: and also cycle through different instances of same app if multiple is running

parts.text: and also cycle through different instances of same app if multiple is running

response.value:
Here’s an updated version that **cycles through all open windows** of the app each time you press the hotkey. It remembers the last activated window for each app and activates the next one in the list.

````ahk

#Requires AutoHotkey v2.0
#SingleInstance Force
#+r::Reload  ; Edit script
#+e::Edit   ; Edit script
#q::WinClose("A")  ; Closes the active window
CapsLock::Esc ; CapsLock to Escape
; Esc::Return ; Disable Escape
; Esc::CapsLock ; Escape to capslock

; ======================================================
; Universal App Launcher / Focus Switcher
; Press your defined hotkeys to launch or activate apps
; ======================================================

#r::RunOrFocusApp("CometBrowser.exe", "C:\Program Files\Comet\CometBrowser.exe")
#e::RunOrFocusApp("Everything.exe", "C:\Program Files\Everything\Everything.exe")
#c::RunOrFocusApp("Calculator.exe", "calc.exe")
#n::RunOrFocusApp("Notepad.exe", "notepad.exe")

global lastWinIdx := Map() ; Stores last window index for each exe

RunOrFocusApp(exeName, exePath) {
    if !ProcessExist(exeName) {
        try {
            Run exePath
        } catch as err {
            MsgBox "Failed to launch " exeName "`nError: " err.Message
        }
        lastWinIdx[exeName] := 1
        return
    }
    winList := []
    WinGetList("ahk_exe " exeName, &winList)
    if winList.Length = 0 {
        Run exePath
        lastWinIdx[exeName] := 1
        return
    }
    idx := lastWinIdx.Has(exeName) ? lastWinIdx[exeName] : 1
    idx := idx + 1
    if idx > winList.Length
        idx := 1
    WinActivate("ahk_id " winList[idx])
    lastWinIdx[exeName] := idx
}
````

**How it works:**
- Each hotkey cycles through all windows of the app.
- Remembers the last activated window for each app.
- Wraps around to the first window after the last.

Let me know if you want further customization!
